title.text: An Earley-style Predictive Chart Parsing Method for Lambek Grammars

abstractContent.text: We present anew chart parsing method for Lambek grammars, inspired by a method for D-Tree grammar parsing.
The formulae of a Lam-bek sequent are firstly converted into rules of an indexed grammar formalism, which are used in an Earley-style predictive chart algorithm.
The method is non-polynomial, but performs well for practical purposes-much better than previous chart methods for Lambek grammars.

introductionContent.text: We present anew chart parsing method for Lambek grammars.
The starting point for this work is the observation, in, of certain similarities between categorial grammars and the D-Tree grammar (DTG) formalism of.
On this basis, we have explored adapting the DTG parsing approach of for use with the Lambek calculus.

The resulting method is one in which the formulae of a Lambek sequent that is to be proven are first converted to produce rules of a formalism which combines ideas from the multiset-valued linear indexed grammar formalism of, with the Lambek calculus span labelling scheme of, and with the first-order compilation method for categorial parsing of.
The resulting 'grammar' is then parsed using an Earley-style predictive chart algorithm which is adapted from.
